title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. A, ch. I, pt. 1 - Executive Orders (Nelson A. Rockefeller)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. A, ch. I, pt. 1 - Executive Orders (Nelson A. Rockefeller)

State Regulations
§ 1.1 - Executive Order No. 1: Establishing an Interdepartmental Health and Hospital Council. [1]
§ 1.2 - Executive Order No. 2: [Directing Temporary State Commission of Investigation to supervise the investigations into the affairs of the City of New York commenced by the Commission on Governmental Operations of the City of New York.]
§ 1.3 - Executive Order No. 3: Relating to sanitation inspections of restaurants by State agencies. [*]
§ 1.4 - Executive Order No. 4: Governor's 1960 code of fair practices
§ 1.5 - Executive order no. 5: recommending special procedures to be followed by parole board in all cases involving individuals convicted of murder or of sex crimes
§ 1.6 - Executive order no. 6: relating to a program for improved safety for state employees driving state-owned passenger cars
§ 1.7 - Executive Order No. 7: Establishing an Advisory Council on Alcoholism
§ 1.8 - Executive Order No. 8: [Extending of enlistments in the New York Army and Air National Guards.]
§ 1.9 - Executive Order No. 9: Amending the Executive Order of July 23, 1960 [No. 5] relating to special psychiatric procedures for examining prospective parolees. [*]
§ 1.10 - Executive Order No. 10: [Appointing special commissioner to investigate corruption or misconduct in government.]
§ 1.11 - Executive Order No. 11: [Continuing Order No. 10.]
§ 1.12 - Executive Order No. 12: [Appointing commissioners to investigate State and local activities relating to the aid, care and support of the needy.]
§ 1.13 - Executive Order No. 13: [Continuing Order No. 12.]
§ 1.14 - Executive Order No. 14: [Appointing commissioners to examine laws with respect to sale and distribution of alcoholic beverages.]
§ 1.15 - Executive order no. 15: relating to procedures for the submission and settlement of grievances of state employees
§ 1.16 - Executive Order No. 16: [Directive to hold public hearings on matters involving the management and administration of public schools in the City of New York.]
§ 1.17 - Executive order no. 17: [directing chief of staff to order units of organized militia into active service to assist in preserving peace and protecting property in the county of monroe and city of rochester.]
§ 1.18 - Executive Order No. 18: [Creating the New York State Office of Economic Opportunity.][*]
§ 1.19 - Executive order no. 19: [establishing responsibilities of state departments concerning the implementation of title xix of the federal social security act.]
§ 1.20 - Executive Order No. 20: Rules and regulations for operation of the Municipal Police Training Council program. [*]
§ 1.21 - Executive order no. 21: establishing a state program to provide job opportunities to the mentally retarded
§ 1.22 - Executive order no. 22: designating the interdepartmental traffic safety committee as the state agency to coordinate and approve state highway safety programs
§ 1.23 - Executive order no. 23: designating the health planning commission as the state's official long-range health planning agency
§ 1.24 - Executive Order No. 24: Relating to the creation of the Health Resources Commission
§ 1.25 - Executive Order No. 25: Amending the Executive Order of May 23, 1967 [No. 23] establishing the Health Planning Commission. [*]
§ 1.26 - Executive Order No. 26: Creation of the Agricultural Resources Commission
§ 1.27 - Executive order no. 27: establishing an interdepartmental committee on human rights
§ 1.28 - Executive order no. 28: designating the social development planning commission as the state's official long-range social development planning agency
§ 1.29 - Executive order no. 29: establishing the office for urban innovation
§ 1.30 - Executive Order No. 30: Creation of the Council of Economic Advisers
§ 1.31 - Executive Order No. 31: Creation of the Crime Control Planning Board and Office of Crime Control Planning. [*]
§ 1.32 - Executive order no. 32: relating to state program for day care centers for children
§ 1.33 - Executive order no. 33: establishing the office for community affairs
§ 1.34 - Executive Order No. 34: Amending the Executive Orders of May 23, 1967 [No. 23] and April 16, 1968 [No. 25] relating to the Health Planning Commission. [*]
§ 1.35 - Executive Order No. 35: Amending the Executive Order of December 17, 1968 [No. 31], relating to the creation of the Crime Control Planning Board and Office of Crime Control Planning. [DAGGER]
§ 1.36 - Executive order no. 36: creating the manpower resources commission
§ 1.37 - Executive Order No. 37: Transfer of title of certain State-owned passenger vehicles from various State departments and agencies to the Office of General Services
§ 1.38 - Executive Order No. 38: Amending the Executive Orders of December 17, 1968 [No. 31] and February 23, 1970 [No. 35], relating to the creation of the Crime Control Planning Board and Office of Crime Control Planning. [*]
§ 1.39 - Executive Order No. 39: Consent to transfer of certain members of the New York Army National Guard and the New York Air National Guard to the Standby Reserve
§ 1.40 - Executive Order No. 40: Amending the Executive Orders of May 23, 1967 [No. 23], April 16, 1968 [No. 25] and October 8, 1969 [No. 34], relating to the Health Planning Commission. [*]
§ 1.41 - Executive order no. 41: relating to the training and development of state employees
§ 1.42 - Executive order no. 42: relating to procedures for submission and settlement of certain grievances of state employees
§ 1.43 - Executive order no. 43: affirmative action training and employment program for minority group members on state and state-aided construction projects in the city of new york
§ 1.44 - Executive Order No. 44: Establishment of State comprehensive planning and development regions
§ 1.45 - Executive Order No. 45: Amending the Executive Order of April 27, 1967 [No. 22], Designating the Interdepartmental Traffic Safety Committee as the State Agency to Coordinate and Approve State Highway Safety Programs. [*]
§ 1.46 - Executive order no. 46: assigning certain functions to the office of planning services and office for local government in connection with the federal model cities program and the federal economic opportunity act of 1964
§ 1.47 - Executive order no. 47: amending and superseding the executive orders of may 23, 1967 [no. 23], april 16, 1968 [no. 25], october 8, 1969 [no. 34] and october 8, 1970 [no. 40], designating the health planning commission as the state's official long-range health planning agency
§ 1.48 - Executive order no. 48: amending and superseding the executive order of september 16, 1968 [no. 28], designating the social development planning commission as the state's official long-range social development planning agency
§ 1.49 - Executive order no. 49: amending and superseding the executive orders of december 17, 1968 [no. 31], february 23, 1970 [no. 35] and june 10, 1970 [no. 38], relating to the creation of the crime control planning board and office of crime control planning
§ 1.50 - Executive order no. 50: amending and superseding the executive order of march 6, 1970 [no. 36], creating the manpower resources commission
§ 1.51 - Executive Order No. 51: Amending the Executive Order of April 2, 1971 [No. 47] relating to the Health Planning Commission. [*]
§ 1.52 - Executive order no. 52: amending and superseding the executive order of april 2, 1971 [no. 50], creating the manpower resources commission
§ 1.53 - Executive Order No. 53: Amending the Executive Orders of March 6, 1970 [No. 36] and April 2, 1971 [No. 50] relating to the Manpower Resources Commission. [*]
§ 1.54 - Executive order no. 54: [directing that the chief of staff order into active service the organized militia to assist authorities in guaranteeing public safety and protecting property in certain counties.]
§ 1.55 - Executive order no. 55: [placing requirement on attorney general in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the county of new york.]
§ 1.56 - Executive Order No. 56: [Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Bronx.] [DAGGER]
§ 1.57 - Executive Order No. 57: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Queens. [DAGGER]
§ 1.58 - Executive Order No. 58: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Kings. [DAGGER]
§ 1.59 - Executive Order No. 59: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Richmond. [DAGGER]
§ 1.60 - Executive order no. 60: renumbered 56.01-see executive order no. 56, supra
§ 1.61 - Executive order no. 61: amending executive order no. 55 by appointing an indefinite extraordinary special and trial term of the supreme court to be held in new york county
§ 1.62 - Executive order no. 62: amending executive order no. 56 by appointing an indefinite extraordinary special and trial term of the supreme court to be held in bronx county
§ 1.63 - Executive order no. 63: amending executive order no. 57 by appointing an indefinite extraordinary special and trial term of the supreme court to be held in queens county
§ 1.64 - Executive order no. 64: amending executive order no. 57 by appointing an indefinite extraordinary special and trial term of the supreme court to be held in the county of kings
§ 1.65 - Executive order no. 65: amending executive order no. 59 by appointing an indefinite extraordinary special and trial term of the supreme court to be held in the county of richmond
§ 1.66 - Executive order no. 66: appointing an extraordinary special and trial term of the supreme court in and for the county of onondaga
§ 1.67 - Executive order no. 67: renumbered 55.01-see executive order no. 55, supra
§ 1.68 - Executive order no. 67: renumbered 55.01-see executive order no. 55, supra
§ 1.69 - Executive order no. 69: renumbered 56.02-see executive order no. 56, supra
§ 1.70 - Executive order no. 70: renumbered 59.02-see executive order no. 59, supra
§ 1.71 - Executive order no. 71: renumbered 58.02-see executive order no. 58, supra
§ 1.72 - Executive order no. 72: renumbered 56.03-see executive order no. 56, supra
§ 1.73 - Executive Order No. 73: Relating to the supervision of food processing establishments and service food establishments. [*]
§ 1.74 - Executive Order No. 74: Repealing and revoking the Executive Order dated April 2, 1971 [No. 49] relating to the Crime Control Planning Board and Office of Crime Control Planning
§ 1.75 - Executive Order No. 75: Amending the Executive Order of April 27, 1967 [No. 22], designating the Interdepartmental Traffic Safety Committee as the State agency to coordinate and approve State highway safety programs
§ 1.76 - Executive Order No. 76: Order relating to provision of emergency procedures to facilitate burial of dead in and near City of New York
§ 1.77 - Executive order no. 77: order relating to the establishment of the office of education performance review
§ 1.78 - Executive Order No. 78: Amending unnumbered Executive Order dated October 29, 1971 regarding inquiry into incident at Attica Correctional Facility

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. A, ch. I, pt. 1

Executive Order No. 7 of Governor Eliot Spitzer ( §
6.7 of this Title); Executive Order No. 9 of Governor David A. Paterson (
§
7.9
of this Title) and Executive

Order No. 2 of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo ( §
8.2
of this Title) repeals, cancels
and revokes in their entirety all Executive Orders issued by Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller with the exception of Executive Order No. 42 ( §
1.42
of this

Part). State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
